title: Love Island's Eoghan Murphy chooses to couple up with Jessie Wynter leaving Maurice Salib in trouble
text:
On Tuesday's episode of Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib's was dumped by Jessie Wynter, with whom he was coupled with on Monday's debut.

The 23-year-old ditched her 27-year-old island partner after saying she was worried he was only on the show to 'seeking publicity'.

And Jessie was overjoyed to be quickly snapped up by intruder Eoghan Murphy, after battling with Cartier Surjan for his attention.

'Hook up or hop off!' Eoghan Murphy chose to couple up with Jessie Wynter leaving Maurice Salib (pictured) in trouble of being eliminated from Love Island Australia on Tuesday night

After Eoghan picked her, Jessie admitted: 'It is really awkward because I'm just really happy right now.'

Eoghan struggled to pick between Cartier and Jessie, and Cartier admitted she was not ready to give up.

Cartier told the others: 'Just because you paired up doesn't mean you are locked into a relationship. Like it is Love Island.

Decisions Eoghan (pictured) struggled to pick between Cartier and Jessie

Issues: Jessie (pictured) had already dumped her island partner Maurice earlier that episode after saying she was worried he was seeking 'publicity'

'I want to get to know him. I don't want to just give Jess every chance, otherwise he will stop paying attention to me. I want to get in there, make my move, make my impact,' she added.

The new coupling has left Maurice facing elimination - unless he can find another partner, fast.

The directions were clear - Maurice got a text reading: 'You are now single and, therefore, at risk of being dumped from the island. Hook up or hop off.'

After Eoghan picked her, Jessie admitted: 'It is really awkward because I'm just really happy right now'

It comes after Maurice's ex-girlfriend Christie Swadling claimed on Tuesday that he dumped her two weeks before appearing on the show.

After savagely labelling him as 'trash' on Instagram during Monday night's premiere, the blonde has now unleashed upon Maurice again in a fiery tell-all uploaded to YouTube on Tuesday.

During the video, which is brazenly titled 'MY BOYFRIEND DUMPED ME FOR A DATING SHOW', Christie claimed that 'fame loving' Maurice called time on their romance two weeks ago.

'My boyfriend dumped me for Love Island Australia!' Maurice's ex-girlfriend Christie Swadling (pictured) claimed he left her TWO WEEKS before going on the show in a video shared Tuesday

She proceeded to claim that Maurice had lied in his official Love Island bio when he claimed he's been single for six months.

'Did he lie in his bio? Yes. We were together within that [six month] time frame,' she declared.

She then turned to the question of whether she knew Maurice would be on Love Island before he dumped her.

'He would have 100 per cent have had to apply for this while we were together,' she added.
description: On Tuesday's episode of Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib's was dumped by Jessie Wynter, with whom he was coupled with on Monday's debut.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
